content.description: Follow the crack up through the topout.
content.location: Stand start at the base of the largest crack on the east face. Start with your hands inside the crack.

content.description: Stand start with a full pad crimp rail, and move up the arete. This has enjoyable and approachable movement for a newer climber.Â
content.protection: A pad. It has a flat landing.
content.location: This is on the first face of the boulder seen as you approach from the parking lot. It's the arete left of the obvious crack, Ridge Crack.

content.description: Stand start with your left hand on a sharp crimp in the hueco and your right hand on... not much. Move up to the sloping lip, and find a way to mantel.
content.protection: A pad. It has a flat landing.
content.location: This is on the side of the boulder facing the trail just right of Cabal.

content.description: Sit start with an OK right hand sidepull to the right of the crack and a high left hand crimp to the left of the crack. Get at least one foot on the obviously good foot hold. Make moves up to the starting holds of the stand start, and continue from there.
content.location: Start at the base of the arete on the ground. It has a good landing zone.

content.description: Start with wide hands and hug the boulder with your torso in line with the crack. Use a good heel hook to bump up the left hand and then follow the crack the rest of the way up. This is a fun compression style, arete problem leading to a fun topout.
content.location: Start by the triangle-shaped hold in the crack of the east-facing arete.

content.description: This is a nice 10-12 foot boulder right off the Ridge Trail near the main entrance of the Reservation. There are a lot of cool cracks and features.
